Pro-Palestinian and pro-Israeli protesters converge on Parliament’s lawn https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/pro-palestinian-and-pro-israeli-protesters-converge-on-parliaments-lawn/OSYQYTSXV5EPHDBKEPQKMRKHOQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/pro-palestinian-and-pro-israeli-protesters-converge-on-parliaments-lawn/OSYQYTSXV5EPHDBKEPQKMRKHOQ/ Pro-Palestine and pro-Israel marches converge at Parliament, each with around 500 protesters. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:52:29 +0000 Pro Israeli and Pro Palestinian supporters face off outside Parliament in Wellington. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Immigration NZ staff sacked after ‘concerning’ Teams chats discovered https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/immigration-nz-staff-sacked-after-concerning-teams-chats-discovered/YSRZKWMDDNF3LPAVKUHX5O2YXU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/immigration-nz-staff-sacked-after-concerning-teams-chats-discovered/YSRZKWMDDNF3LPAVKUHX5O2YXU/ 'No place for inappropriate communication', says INZ after staff are disciplined. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:49:58 +0000 Sixteen staff members at several branches of Immigration New Zealand (INZ) have been disciplined following the discovery of comments on Teams chats about visa applicants. Photo / 123rf
Watch live: Government grilled in Question Time on new Interislander Ferries https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-nicola-willis-and-winston-peters-reveal-plans-for-interislander-ferries/5OIUPL3CJJCIJFLOZI5KTD73GQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-nicola-willis-and-winston-peters-reveal-plans-for-interislander-ferries/5OIUPL3CJJCIJFLOZI5KTD73GQ/ Thomas Coughlan, Georgina Campbell, Adam PearseCost blowout forced cancellation of project started under Labour Government. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:48:22 +0000 Finance Minister Nicola Willis and newly appointed Minister for Rail Winston Peters during their press conference where they revealed the Government would establish a new schedule 4a Crown company to procure two new ferries to begin service by 2029, Parliament, Wellington. 11 December, 2024. NZME photograph by Mark Mitchell
Hawke’s Bay: Two men caught with 353 undersized pāua to face charges https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hawkes-bay-two-men-caught-with-353-undersized-paua-to-face-charges/7X472FC3N5FLPAU2D6QZJMQ2PY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hawkes-bay-two-men-caught-with-353-undersized-paua-to-face-charges/7X472FC3N5FLPAU2D6QZJMQ2PY/ Police stopped the car due to complaints about driving by members of public. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:46:16 +0000 Two men were caught with a massive haul of undersized pāua.
Kopu Marine Precinct in Thames to remain off-limits to public https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/kopu-marine-precinct-in-thames-to-remain-off-limits-to-public/LAEQJPBEANDDHLVJLPC52IEV5A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/kopu-marine-precinct-in-thames-to-remain-off-limits-to-public/LAEQJPBEANDDHLVJLPC52IEV5A/ Al WilliamsIt is not getting heavy commercial use but the council voted to keep the gates locked. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:30:13 +0000 Kopu Marine Servicing and Business Precinct was opened by Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters in June. The main wharf will remain closed to the public after the Thames-Coromandel District Council undertook a feasibility study following pleas from locals for it to open.
Christchurch house fire: Resident found dead inside home as firefighters continue to battle blaze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hornby-christchurch-house-fire-firefighters-work-to-contain-serious-blaze/6PWG5YT645C6LDZ5HNYSFU4MMI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hornby-christchurch-house-fire-firefighters-work-to-contain-serious-blaze/6PWG5YT645C6LDZ5HNYSFU4MMI/ Katie OliverThree roads in the area are cordoned off while firefighters work to contain the blaze. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:19:40 +0000 Fire, police and ambulance were all called to the fire. Photo / George Heard
Flaxmere sign ‘monstrosity’ removed after resident’s protest https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/flaxmere-sign-monstrosity-removed-after-residents-protest/HVK4FUWBXJCSHDYVJJISAVFOP4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/flaxmere-sign-monstrosity-removed-after-residents-protest/HVK4FUWBXJCSHDYVJJISAVFOP4/ Linda HallHow one Flaxmere resident's campaign led to removal of a controversial 'H' sign. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:18:49 +0000 Flaxmere resident Mark Davis was appalled when he first laid eyes on the Hastings District Council Gateway sign in Flaxmere Ave. He rallied the community and now the sign has been removed.
Sweetcorn: Gisborne’s crops harvested early after perfect growing conditions https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/sweetcorn-gisbornes-crops-harvested-early-after-perfect-having-conditions/G32JH7X5TZAAJEQGEMJNQE7QC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/sweetcorn-gisbornes-crops-harvested-early-after-perfect-having-conditions/G32JH7X5TZAAJEQGEMJNQE7QC4/ Alexa CookThe region’s sweetcorn is ready for picking and will be in stores this week. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:14:11 +0000 Gisborne grower Gordon McPhail says they are expecting to pick 850,000 cobs in the region over the next two weeks. Photo / Brennan Thomas
Rotorua Specialist School – Te Kura Pūkenga o Rotorua celebrates 60th diamond jubilee https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-specialist-school-te-kura-pukenga-o-rotorua-celebrates-60th-diamond-jubilee/K2HF5JKOSVD6PPQ3VFRLKFTYK4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-specialist-school-te-kura-pukenga-o-rotorua-celebrates-60th-diamond-jubilee/K2HF5JKOSVD6PPQ3VFRLKFTYK4/ The event was attended by more than 150 guests. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:07:57 +0000 Rotorua Specialist School – Te Kura Pūkenga o Rotorua current presiding member, Terena Wara, speaks at the school's 60th diamond jubilee celebrations.
New court documents reveal why South Auckland prison inmate Donovan Duff killed again https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/new-court-documents-reveal-why-south-auckland-prison-inmate-donovan-duff-killed-again/36SY46S7SNBZ7AGUE747ZIY5FI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/new-court-documents-reveal-why-south-auckland-prison-inmate-donovan-duff-killed-again/36SY46S7SNBZ7AGUE747ZIY5FI/ Craig KapitanDonovan Duff's name and criminal history had been kept secret until today. Wed, 11 Dec 2024 02:04:53 +0000 Donovan Michael Duff, who was found guilty in the High Court at Rotorua in 2018 of murdering his baby daughter, has pleaded guilty in the High Court at Auckland to the 2023 murder of fellow inmate Brian George at Auckland South Corrections Facility. Photo / Jason Oxenham
